shortdesc.ph: Starts a last-mile network probe test before a call.
Starts a last-mile network probe test before a call.
Starts the last-mile network probe test before a call.
Starts last-mile network quality probe before a call.

section.p: Performs a last-mile network probe test before a call to report uplink and downlink bandwidth, packet loss, jitter, and round-trip time.
Starts a last-mile network probe test before a call to provide feedback on uplink and downlink bandwidth, packet loss, jitter, and round-trip time.
Starts the last-mile network probe test to report the uplink and downlink bandwidth, packet loss, jitter, and round-trip time to the user.
Performs a last-mile network quality probe before a call, providing feedback on uplink and downlink bandwidth, packet loss, jitter, and round-trip time.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before joining a channel. Do not call other methods before receiving the and callbacks, or this method may fail due to excessive API calls.
This method must be called before joining a channel. Do not call other methods until you receive the and callbacks, or this method may fail due to frequent API calls.
You must call this method before joining a channel, and do not call other methods before receiving the and callbacks. Otherwise, this method may fail due to frequent API calls.
This method must be called before joining a channel. Do not call other methods before receiving the and callbacks, or this method may fail due to frequent API operations.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p:
After successfully calling this method, the SDK triggers the following two callbacks in sequence:
, returned within about 2 seconds depending on network conditions. This callback provides a score-based assessment of uplink and downlink quality, closer to the user's subjective experience.
, returned within about 30 seconds depending on network conditions. This callback provides objective data on uplink and downlink quality.

After successfully calling this method, the SDK triggers the following two callbacks in sequence:
, returned within about 2 seconds depending on the network. This callback provides a score-based evaluation of network quality, which reflects the user's subjective experience.
, returned within about 30 seconds depending on the network. This callback provides objective data on network quality.

After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the following two callbacks:
, which returns within about 2 seconds depending on the network conditions. This callback provides a score-based assessment of the uplink and downlink network quality, reflecting the userâ€™s subjective experience.
, which returns within about 30 seconds depending on the network conditions. This callback provides detailed metrics for a more objective evaluation of the uplink and downlink network quality.

After successfully calling this method, the SDK triggers the following two callbacks in order:
, returned in about 2 seconds depending on network conditions. This callback provides a subjective evaluation of network quality.
, returned in about 30 seconds depending on network conditions. This callback provides objective network quality data.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
